result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Mayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and any victim surcharges; by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay all applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan. If revoked, court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBAITON/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- No Contact with the victim or co-actor.
- Follow all rules of supervison and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes:
**09-17-15/ Dennis Cimpl**
The Court ordered the defendant to serve the HOC condition time, Straight.  
Huber privileges are revoked.        

Can be served at the Day Reporting Center; STAYED commencement until 08-14-15 by 5pm.

records.addlTxt:
Amendment To Judgment Of Conviction And Order - ERP

-  IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

-  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders. mg

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (24 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING, commencing JULY 30, 2015, received and filed.
Reflects 09-17-15 Court order (WCCS) cancelling Huber
Case called.  No appearances.  Court orders defendant to serve the House of Correction condition time straight.  Huber privileges are revoked.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

There are no appearances.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  The House of Corrections has notified the court that defendant has failed to report to the HOC to serve condition time.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Cimpl Br 19 for review. os
Bail Refund Packets
8/11/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS with 15 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.


Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 4 months and 15 days condition time.  This can be served at the Day Reporting Center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathlyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim or co-actor.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:

Victim Impact Statement    
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Court stayed commencement until 08/14/2015 by 5:00pm.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Report.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr, who appeared by telephone.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 for Branch 22.  Entry made without file.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  State requests admonishment only, as defendant has a court date on 7/30/15.  Defense counsel concurs, and indicated his client is to enroll in a treatment program.  Court admonished defendant and warned that this would be the LAST admonishment; change in bail would occur for any future violations.  Justice Point caseworker notified.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case adjourned before Branch 22 for projected guilty plea on 7/30/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit, but re-gained contact. Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr.  Irene Parthum for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 on 07/30/2015 at 8:30am for plea hearing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test. Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 immediately for bail review.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Gregory Roger Parr.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in custody.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rebecca M. or Derrick G.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Absolute Sobriety to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Nicholas J Mayer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
